items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A @item Monster Hunter's Pack|vrgr}, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: The Beast Within
entries: Each full moon, you turn into a werewolf under the DM’s control for the night. Unless caged or fully restrained with silver manacles, you go on a bloody rampage. Each full moon happens 3 consecutive nights per month. Each morning after a full moon, you must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom save or suffer a long-term madness until dusk. Each subsequent full moon, the Wisdom save DC increases by 1. During the waxing gibbous phase (4 consecutive days before the full moon), you must make a Nightmare check (see {@variantrule Nightmare|LegendsOfBarovia}). If you succeed you feel a change coming

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: You have been cursed with a virulent strain of lycanthropy that resists remove curse.

rows: I am not trusting of others and am afraid of how they will judge me if they know the truth.
The first things I notice about a new location are the exits—in case I have to escape.
I enjoy the outdoors; fresh air makes me feel invigorated.
I feel empathy for those who are different.
I anger quickly if I see someone mistreat animals.
I constantly am hungry for fresh meat; the smell makes me salivate.
Natural Order. I respect the natural order of things. (Neutral)
Live and Let Live. I do not harm or seek to change others through violence. (Neutral)
Honor. If I dishonor myself, I dishonor those who stand by me. (Lawful)
Independence. I value making my own decisions (Chaotic)
Glory. I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my allies. (Any)
Adventure. I enjoy the journey more than the destination. (Any)
I see awful visions of what I may do, and I protect those I care about and try to prevent it.
I owe my allegiance to those who protect me from myself.
No one else should have to be burdened by my hardships.
I am guilty by nature, so I constantly strive to redeem myself.
I would give my life to those who have helped save mine.
My anger got someone hurt; I will learn to control my anger.
I lie to others to hide my secret.
I know I have power to change things, and sometimes use it without considering the consequences. I must learn to control my power.
My hatred for the enemy is blinding.
I have little respect for those who are not proven in battle
I harbor bloodthirsty thoughts on clear nights when I can see the moon.
I am headstrong and stubbornly seek an end to my curse, sometimes making rash decisions.

variantrule.name: Nightmare
entries: If a creature has less than 50 percent of its hit points or any level of exhaustion before taking a long rest, it may suffer from nightmares. The creature must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or gain one random effect from the Nightmare table. This effect lasts until the creature’s next long rest. A creature that fails its saving throw also only gains half of the hit points that would normally be restored during a long rest

entries.caption: Nightmare
rows: Horrid dreams of death
1 random long-term madness
Fear of failing
Initiative set to 1 for all encounters

Scared of the dark

Horrific vision

variantrule.name: Despair
entries: A melancholic atmosphere pervades Barovia, and creatures who spend an extended amount of time there may succumb to it. Creatures who experience one of the following situations must make a Despair check:

items: Having along rest or short rest interrupted in an unsecured location
Waking from a long rest after suffering the loss of a fellow party member
Seeing a fellow party member suffer from long-term or indefinite madness

entries: Creatures who face Despair must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw DC 10 or be affected by a random Despair effect on the Despair table below. If a creature is already suffering a Despair effect and fails the saving throw, the new despair effect replaces the old one.

After finishing a short rest, a creature can attempt to overcome Despair by making a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the Despair effect ends for that creature. Calm emotions, lesser restoration, and greater restoration also remove Despair. Other spells or potions found in Barovia may also remove despair.
The Legends of Barovia campaign guides provide suggestions for when to roll Despair checks, though a creature should not make more than one Despair check per day.

entries.caption: Despair
rows: {@b Apathy.} The character has disadvantage on death saving throws and on Dexterity checks for initiative and gains the following flaw: ´I don't believe I can make a difference to anyone or anything.´
{@b Dread.} The character has disadvantage on all saving 45 throws and gains the following flaw: ´Iam convinced that this place is going to kill me.´
{@b Insane.} The character has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, and gains the following flaw: ´I can't tell what's real anymore.´
